title: Drawing, "Sacrifice of Noah", ca. 1600–50
medium: Brush and brown wash, pen and ink,on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, lower right: Monrealese
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The drawing if of the story of the Sacrifice of Noah.  To the bottom right Noah is kneeling at the foot of the altar he built.  His sacrifice of a ram is shown on the altar amongst the fire, while a cloud of smoke rises from it.  To the left there is a crowd looking on.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sacrifice of Noah", ca. 1600–50.
ca. 1600–50. Brush and brown wash, pen and ink,on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8324.
